{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3495863,"name":"Val","username":"Otter502","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/otter502/{size}/245799_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-29T19:30:42.097Z","cooked":"

I have heard a lot about SysID and have tried to get into it and have been having trouble knowing where to start?
Any recommendations on where to start for learning how to use sysID this season would be greatly appreciated!
I’ve done my best to look over the docs but I was also wondering if anyone had a useful way of teaching / explaining it that they find particularly helpful / insightful!

Thank you so much in advanced!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-01-29T21:01:52.061Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":12,"reads":100,"readers_count":99,"score":125.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":484144,"topic_slug":"sysid-what-are-some-good-places-to-start","display_username":"Val","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63596,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming"},"post_url":"/t/sysid-what-are-some-good-places-to-start/484144/1","custom_user_title":"Programming","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3495934,"name":"","username":"ninjadrknss","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ninjadrknss/{size}/247388_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-29T20:38:59.594Z","cooked":"

A pretty easy way to start (if you have the space) is drivetrain characterization for translation. One of the wpilib examples is similar to what I am suggesting: Running the Identification Routine — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation. If you are using modern CTRE motors, they offer a lot of good code stubs for running the routines: Plumbing & Running SysId.

Would we run two sets of sysID routines for the steering and drive motors?
(we run yagsl w/ SparkMax NEOs)

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-01-29T20:56:08.944Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":72,"readers_count":71,"score":29.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":484144,"topic_slug":"sysid-what-are-some-good-places-to-start","display_username":"Val","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":57180,"username":"ninjadrknss","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ninjadrknss/{size}/247388_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63596,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming"},"post_url":"/t/sysid-what-are-some-good-places-to-start/484144/3","custom_user_title":"Programming","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3495981,"name":"","username":"ninjadrknss","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ninjadrknss/{size}/247388_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-29T21:30:35.317Z","cooked":"

In the case I described, you would only run on the drive motors (set the voltage of all of modules’ drive in the lamba) while having the steer motors locked to the forward position. I recommended this routine as it is the best documented IMO, and is one of the easier ones to run without breaking stuff (and you can just run it on a dev drivebase too). This routine would help you find the drive PID values for auton translation. If you wanted to instead find the PID values for the steering motors (ie for the pid loop to angle them while driving) that would require a different routine setup.
